page.title: 12Facilities in Palehouse
page.content: Facilities in this area are rather limited. The butcher, general store, post office and public house have closed recently. Residents now have to travel several miles to shop. Travel is generally by car or on foot, although there is a bus service which operates during school terms. There is a children's play area which is only used occasionally as there are few children here. There is no church. The nearest is in Framfield which communicates with Palehouse through a noticeboard in the hamlet. Other facilities include a telephone box and post box on the main road. The dustmen collect rubbish once a week and the mail and milk are delivered regularly. The residents are mainly farmers although some are commuters. In their leisure time,most people go for walks and collect wood for their fires.
